    • Method Detail

      • isValidDispatchInterval

        public static boolean isValidDispatchInterval(int seconds)
        Checks whether or not the provided interval is valid and reasonable. This method will warn the user upon unreasonable usage, e.g. by mistaking seconds for milliseconds.
        Parameters:
        seconds - the amount of seconds to wait before each batch is dispatch
        Returns:
        true if the provided interval is valid and reasonable

      • isHttps

        public static boolean isHttps(java.lang.String endpoint)
        Checks whether or not an endpoint is communicated over using HTTPS.
        Parameters:
        endpoint - backend endpoint
        Returns:
        true on https

      • isValidEndpoint

        public static boolean isValidEndpoint(java.lang.String endpoint)
        Checks whether or not the provided endpoint is in valid format. This does not check whether or not the endpoint actually exists / is online.
        Parameters:
        endpoint - URL pointing to a backend
        Returns:
        true if the parameter is valid

      • isAllowedToDispatchEvents

        public static boolean isAllowedToDispatchEvents(boolean usingHttpEndpoint)
        Checks whether or not the client is allowed to dispatch events to the backend.
        Parameters:
        usingHttpEndpoint - indicates whether or not app is using the HTTPS protocol to dispatch events
        Returns:
        true if this client is allowed to dispatch events

      • isValidMaxRetries

        public static boolean isValidMaxRetries(int maxRetries)
        Checks whether or not the max retries given is above 0. Anything above is allowed. Some insanely high values may not make much sense, and will be given a warning, but allowed.
        Parameters:
        maxRetries - the amount of times to retry dispatching events
        Returns:
        true if the max retries value is allowed
